actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Foreign Relations.

official_title: A resolution relating to the treaty powers of the Senate.

summary.text: Treaty Powers Resolution - Expresses the sense of the Senate that any international agreement which involves a significant political, military, or economic commitment to a foreign country which has not been authorized by statute or treaty and is not entered into pursuant to emergency circumstances constitutes a treaty and should be submitted to the Senate for its advice and consent. Provides that the Senate may, by resolution, find that any international agreement hereafter entered into which has not been submitted to the Senate for its advice and consent constitutes a treaty. States that it shall not be in order to consider any bill or joint resolution or any amendment thereto, or any report of a committee of conference, which authorizes or provides budget authority to implement any international agreement which the Senate has found to constitute a treaty unless the Senate has given its advice and consent to ratification of such agreement.

titles.title: A resolution relating to the treaty powers of the Senate.
